metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：水文气象观测网数据集（混合林站自动气象站-2013）
metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Hydrometeorological observation network obtained from the automatic weather station (AWS) at the observation system of Meteorological elements gradient of Sidaoqiao mixed forest station between 12 July, 2013, and 31 December, 2013. The site (101.134° E, 41.990° N) was located on a tamarix and populous forest (Tamarix chinensis Lour. and Populus euphratica Olivier.) surface in the Sidaoqiao, Dalaihubu Town, Ejin Banner, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. The elevation is 874 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (HMP45D; 28 m, north), wind speed and direction profile (034B; 28 m, north), air pressure (AV-410BP; in tamper box), rain gauge (52203; 28 m, south), four-component radiometer (CNR4; 24 m, south), two infrared temperature sensors (IRTC3; 24 m, south, vertically downward), two photosynthetically active radiation (PQS-1; 24 m, south, one vertically upward and one vertically downward), soil heat flux (HFP01; 3 duplicates, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (AV-10T; 0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.6 and -1.0 m), and soil moisture profile (ML2X; install on Dec. 7, 2013, -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.6 and -1.0 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_28 m; RH_28 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_28 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_28 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), photosynthetically active radiation of upward and downward (PAR_up and PAR_down) (μmol/ (s m^-2)), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2 and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_60 cm and Ts_100 cm) (℃), and soil moisture (Ms_2 cm, Ms_4 cm, Ms_10 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_60 cm and Ms_100 cm) (%, volumetric water content).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2013-9-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Li et al. (2013) (for hydrometeorological observation network or sites information), Liu et al. (2011) (for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2013年7月12日至2013年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网下游混合林站气象要素观测数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗达来呼布镇四道桥，下垫面是柽柳与胡杨。观测点的经纬度是101.1335E,41.9903N，海拔874m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在28m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在28m处；风速与风向传感器架设在28m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在24m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在24m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；两个光合有效辐射仪安装在24m处，朝向正南，探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm、100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器（2013年12月7日安装）埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm、100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_28m、RH_28m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_28m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_28m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_up、PAR_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2013-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）通量测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估计蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡动相关（EC）测量来更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米高度的气温、风速和湿度，12米高度的四分量辐射（使用四分量辐射计测量），以及4.5米高度的湍流通量（使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度协方差系统测量）。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境恶化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们展示了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，涵盖了2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of the challenges faced during data collection in arid regions, particularly regarding ecological environment degradation?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区进行数据收集时，特别是在生态环境退化方面，面临的挑战包括：水资源匮乏使得生物多样性监测变得困难；土壤侵蚀和沙漠化导致生态系统的变化，影响数据的准确性；以及极端气候条件（如高温和干旱）限制了现场调查的时间和频率。此外，基础设施不足和交通不便也会影响数据收集的效率和质量。
Example.AnswerEn: An example of challenges faced during data collection in arid regions includes dealing with ecological environment degradation such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, as observed in several inland river basins like the Tarim River basin and the Aral Sea basin.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区进行数据收集时面临的挑战之一是生态环境退化，例如河流和湖泊的干涸、自然植被的退化、土地沙漠化的加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，这在塔里木河流域和阿拉尔海流域等多个内陆河流域中都有所观察。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What specific features of the oasis–desert systems are crucial for evaluating the balance between these ecosystems and ensuring sustainable development?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 评估绿洲-沙漠系统之间的平衡以及确保可持续发展的关键特征有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: energy exchange dynamics, water vapor exchange dynamics, carbon exchange dynamics, hydrometeorology, vegetation, soil parameters
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 能量交换动态、水汽交换动态、碳交换动态、水文气象学、植被、土壤参数

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the elevation of the location where ground-based measurements are collected for evaluating soil and canopy component temperatures?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 用于评估土壤和树冠组件温度的地面测量收集地点的海拔是多少？

Definition.QuestionEn: What does data quality control entail in the context of observational datasets for oasis-desert systems?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的观察性数据集的背景下，数据质量控制涉及什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Data quality control in the context of observational datasets for oasis-desert systems involves processes such as data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing. This ensures that the data are accurate, reliable, and suitable for use in analyzing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in these environments.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的观察性数据集背景下，数据质量控制涉及数据收集、数据处理以及数据归档和共享等过程。这确保了数据的准确性、可靠性，并适合用于分析这些环境中的能量、水汽和碳交换。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do data collection methods for hydrometeorological observations in oasis-desert systems compare to those used for hydrometeorological observations in mixed forest environments?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，水文气象观测的数据收集方法与混合森林环境中的水文气象观测方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Data collection in oasis-desert systems involves long-term observational datasets including energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes, and hydrometeorological data collected from automatic weather stations. In contrast, mixed forest environments, such as the one described in the metadata, focus on meteorological parameters like air temperature, humidity, and soil temperature profiles, collected at different heights and depths to capture the microclimate variations associated with vegetation and soil interactions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，数据收集涉及长期观测数据集，包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及从自动气象站收集的水文气象数据。相比之下，混合森林环境（如元数据中描述的环境）则侧重于气象参数，如空气温度、湿度和土壤温度剖面，这些数据在不同高度和深度收集，以捕捉与植被和土壤相互作用相关的微气候变化。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges of measuring evapotranspiration in arid agricultural areas differ from those encountered in mixed forest ecosystems?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在干旱农业地区，测量蒸散发的挑战与混合森林生态系统中遇到的挑战有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Arid agricultural areas face challenges such as strong advective conditions and incomplete energy balance closure, which affect the accuracy of evapotranspiration measurements. In mixed forest ecosystems, the focus is on the complexity of separating soil and canopy component temperatures, as well as the influence of heterogeneous landscapes and vegetation abundance on measurement accuracy.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 干旱农业地区面临着强烈的平流条件和能量平衡闭合不完全等挑战，这些因素影响了蒸散发测量的准确性。在混合森林生态系统中，重点在于分离土壤和树冠组分温度的复杂性，以及异质景观和植被丰度对测量准确性的影响。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the similarities and differences in the instrumentation used for measuring soil and canopy temperatures in oasis-desert systems compared to mixed forest environments?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统与混合森林环境中，测量土壤和树冠温度所使用的仪器的相似性和差异性是什么？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Both oasis-desert systems and mixed forest environments utilize thermal infrared cameras for measuring soil and canopy temperatures. However, in oasis-desert systems, these measurements are complemented by eddy covariance systems and scintillometers to capture turbulent fluxes, whereas mixed forest environments rely on a combination of soil temperature probes at various depths and infrared thermometers positioned to monitor surface radiative temperatures.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统和混合森林环境都利用热红外相机测量土壤和树冠温度。然而，在绿洲-沙漠系统中，这些测量还辅以涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪，以捕捉湍流通量，而混合森林环境则依赖于在不同深度的土壤温度探头和红外温度计的组合，以监测表面辐射温度。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do the placement and calibration of sensors affect the reliability and accuracy of meteorological and hydrological data collected in arid and semi-arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 传感器的放置和校准如何影响在干旱和半干旱地区收集的气象和水文数据的可靠性和准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The placement of sensors such as air temperature, humidity, wind speed, and soil moisture sensors at specific heights and depths ensures that they capture representative data of the local environment. Calibration is crucial to ensure that the data collected is accurate and consistent. In the Heihe River Basin, for instance, sensors are placed at various heights and depths to capture detailed meteorological and soil data, which is then processed with quality control measures such as removing duplicate records and marking doubtful data.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 传感器如空气温度、湿度、风速和土壤湿度传感器的放置高度和深度确保它们能够捕捉到当地环境的代表性数据。校准对于确保收集的数据准确且一致至关重要。例如，在黑河流域，传感器被放置在不同的高度和深度，以捕捉详细的气象和土壤数据，这些数据随后经过质量控制措施处理，如删除重复记录和标记可疑数据。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in measuring evaporation and transpiration accurately in arid and semiarid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，准确测量蒸发和蒸腾的挑战因素包括哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenges in accurately measuring evaporation and transpiration in arid and semiarid regions arise from composite temperature separation approaches being limited in effectiveness, especially in these regions. Additionally, errors in deriving component temperatures are primarily caused by image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance, and uncertainties in EC system measurements. The strong advective environment and atmospheric conditions further complicate accurate measurements.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，准确测量蒸发和蒸腾面临的挑战主要源于复合温度分离方法在这些地区的有效性有限。此外，导出组成温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误造成的，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化，以及EC系统测量的不确定性。强烈的平流环境和大气条件进一步使准确测量变得复杂。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it crucial to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Maintaining balance between oasis and desert systems is crucial because oases are critical ecological landscapes that support more than 90% of the population in arid regions. They play a significant role in regional ecological stability, agricultural productivity, and socioeconomic development, particularly in areas like western China. Disruptions in these systems can lead to ecological degradation, affecting the carbon balance and exacerbating environmental issues like land desertification and dust storms.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要，因为绿洲是支持干旱地区超过90%人口的关键生态景观。它们在区域生态稳定性、农业生产力和社会经济发展中发挥着重要作用，特别是在中国西部地区。这些系统的破坏可能导致生态退化，影响碳平衡，并加剧土地沙漠化和沙尘暴等环境问题。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using automated meteorological stations for data collection in mixed forest ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在混合森林生态系统中使用自动气象站进行数据收集的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of automated meteorological stations allows for continuous measurement of various environmental parameters, ensuring a high temporal resolution with data collected every 10 minutes. This leads to comprehensive datasets that can identify trends and anomalies in local weather patterns, soil moisture, and radiation dynamics, which are crucial for understanding ecological and hydrological processes in mixed forest ecosystems.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 自动气象站的使用允许对各种环境参数进行连续测量，确保以每10分钟收集一次数据的高时间分辨率。这导致了全面的数据集，可以识别混合森林生态系统中局部天气模式、土壤湿度和辐射动态的趋势和异常，这对于理解生态和水文过程至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary objective of establishing a meteorological observation network with detailed data collection methods for hydrometeorological variables in arid and semi-arid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区建立气象观测网络并采用详细的数据收集方法的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objective is to understand the characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, which is crucial for achieving the goals of carbon peaking and neutrality, supporting ecological security, and ensuring sustainable development of these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的特征，这对于实现碳达峰和碳中和目标、支持生态安全以及确保这些地区的可持续发展至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the intended goals of creating long-term datasets comprising energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes in oasis–desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 创建包含绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的长期数据集的预期目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The intended goals include achieving a quantitative understanding of oasis–desert interactions, protecting ecological stability, supporting socioeconomic development, and addressing ecological challenges like desertification and dust storms in arid inland river basins.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 预期目标包括实现对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的定量理解，保护生态稳定，支持社会经济发展，以及应对干旱内陆河流流域的生态挑战，如沙漠化和沙尘暴。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can a dataset of hydrometeorological observations be meticulously processed and quality-controlled to ensure reliable data for research on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何对水文气象观测数据集进行细致的处理和质量控制，以确保在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中进行能量、水蒸气和碳交换研究时数据的可靠性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control procedure involves collecting data, processing it, and archiving and sharing it. The hydrometeorological data, including radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles, are observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period. Additionally, the procedure includes ensuring data completeness, removing duplicates, deleting outliers, and marking questionable data as per the metadata guidelines.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序包括收集数据、处理数据以及归档和共享数据。水文气象数据，包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量和土壤湿度剖面，均通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测。此外，该程序还包括确保数据完整性、去除重复数据、删除异常值以及根据元数据指南标记可疑数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What instrumental techniques are employed to measure soil and canopy component temperatures for the estimation of evapotranspiration in agricultural research fields?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在农业研究领域中，为了估算蒸散发，采用了哪些仪器技术来测量土壤和冠层成分的温度？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The soil and canopy component temperatures are measured using a high-precision thermal infrared camera. The thermal radiation of the cropland is measured approximately every 120 minutes using thermal images collected from a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower. The component temperatures are calculated by classifying visible and NIR images into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method, extracting directional brightness temperatures, and converting thermal infrared temperatures to radiation temperatures using observed long-wave radiation and emissivities.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 土壤和冠层组件温度使用高精度热红外相机进行测量。通过从边界层塔上的25米高平台每120分钟左右收集热图像，测量农田的热辐射。组件温度通过使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素，提取方向亮度温度，并使用观测到的长波辐射和发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度来计算。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural steps are involved in establishing and maintaining a network of meteorological stations for long-term observation of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn:
建立和维护一个气象站网络，以便在干旱地区长期观察能量、水蒸气和碳通量的程序步骤包括：

1. **需求评估**：确定研究目标和所需数据类型。
2. **选址**：选择适合的地点，考虑气候、地形和人类活动的影响。
3. **设备选择**：选择合适的气象仪器和传感器，以测量能量、水蒸气和碳通量。
4. **站点建设**：安装气象站，包括基础设施建设和设备安装。
5. **数据采集**：设置数据采集系统，确保数据的准确性和可靠性。
6. **数据传输**：建立数据传输系统，确保实时或定期将数据传输到中心数据库。
7. **维护计划**：制定定期维护和校准计划，以确保设备正常运行。
8. **数据管理**：建立数据管理系统，进行数据存储、处理和分析。
9. **结果发布**：定期发布研究结果和数据，促进科学交流和应用。
10. **持续评估**：定期评估网络的有效性和数据质量，进行必要的调整和改进。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The network involves establishing land surface flux and meteorological stations, which include superstations and ordinary stations, to acquire data since 2012. The stations are equipped with eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations to measure turbulent fluxes, hydrometeorological parameters, and groundwater table data. The procedure includes ensuring regular data collection, processing, and archiving, supplemented with vegetation and soil parameters, and is focused on long-term observation to support ecological and socioeconomic studies in oasis–desert systems.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该网络涉及建立地表通量和气象站，包括超级站和普通站，自2012年以来获取数据。这些站配备了涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站，以测量湍流通量、水文气象参数和地下水位数据。该程序包括确保定期数据收集、处理和归档，并补充植被和土壤参数，重点关注长期观察，以支持绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态和社会经济研究。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the integration of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers enable accurate measurement of turbulent fluxes in complex terrains?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪的结合如何在复杂地形中实现湍流通量的准确测量？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance systems and scintillometers, which measure turbulent fluxes including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, are integrated to provide half-hourly data that allow for accurate assessment of the exchanges in oasis-desert systems, thereby enhancing the understanding of these dynamics in complex terrains.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪用于测量包括能量、水蒸气和碳通量在内的湍流通量，这些系统集成在一起提供半小时的数据，从而能够准确评估绿洲-沙漠系统中的交换过程，增强对复杂地形中这些动态的理解。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways does the use of high-precision thermal infrared cameras enhance the accuracy of surface temperature measurements for evapotranspiration modeling?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 高精度热红外相机在蒸散发建模中提高表面温度测量准确性的方式有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: High-precision thermal infrared cameras provide ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, which are crucial for improving the accuracy of the two-source energy balance model in estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration in heterogeneous land surfaces.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 高精度热红外相机提供了地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度，这对于提高两源能量平衡模型在估算异质地表的蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发的准确性至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collection in arid and semi-arid regions present significant challenges for capturing accurate energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange measurements?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，数据收集可能会对捕捉准确的能量、水蒸气和碳交换测量带来重大挑战。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semi-arid areas face ecological environment degradation issues such as drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, which can complicate data collection efforts.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化问题，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，这些都可能使数据收集工作变得复杂。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What factors could contribute to the high uncertainty in estimating surface fluxes using models in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，估计表面通量时高不确定性的因素有哪些？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Uncertainty in surface-air temperature difference, errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures, and a strong advective environment can all contribute to high uncertainty in model estimations.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 地表空气温度差异的不确定性、从复合辐射温度中确定地表土壤和植被组分温度的误差，以及强烈的平流环境，都可能导致模型估计中的高不确定性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it challenging to accurately separate and measure evaporation and transpiration in heterogeneous land surfaces using current data collection methods?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在异质土地表面上，使用当前的数据收集方法准确分离和测量蒸发和蒸腾是具有挑战性的。
Expectation.AnswerEn: The current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in effectiveness in arid regions, and errors in image classification, atmospheric radiation, and transmittance can lead to uncertainties in temperature estimates, impacting the accurate separation and measurement of evaporation and transpiration.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 当前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限，图像分类、大气辐射和透射率的误差可能导致温度估计的不确定性，从而影响蒸发和蒸腾的准确分离和测量。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in ensuring data quality and reliability when measuring turbulent fluxes in arid and semiarid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在测量干旱和半干旱地区的湍流通量时，确保数据质量和可靠性可能面临的挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges in ensuring data quality and reliability include the incomplete energy balance closure in eddy covariance (EC) flux measurements, especially under strongly advective conditions. Additionally, errors in image classification and uncertainties in the estimation of incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances can affect the derived component temperatures, impacting the accuracy of the measurements. The complex interactions in oasis–desert systems necessitate meticulous data processing and quality control to address these challenges.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 确保数据质量和可靠性的挑战包括在强烈的平流条件下，涡度协方差（EC）通量测量中能量平衡闭合的不完整。此外，图像分类中的错误以及对入射短波和长波辐射透射率估计的不确定性可能影响导出组件温度，从而影响测量的准确性。绿洲-沙漠系统中的复杂相互作用需要细致的数据处理和质量控制，以应对这些挑战。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data from various sensors in heterogeneous landscapes are collected and processed to ensure accuracy in evapotranspiration models.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在异质景观中如何收集和处理来自各种传感器的数据，以确保蒸散发模型的准确性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The field uses a combination of ground-based measurements, such as those from eddy covariance systems and thermal infrared cameras, to accurately estimate soil and canopy component temperatures.
